name: Noble Grace
description: You rely on an aristocratic bearing and polished manners to open doors in high society.

name: Earthworker’s Simplicity
description: You lean on plain speech and common wisdom to earn trust among laborers and frontier folk.

name: Silvered Tongue
description: Your smooth words and friendly smile grease the wheels of commerce and bureaucracy.

name: Ironhide Stoicism
description: You project unflappable strength—guards and mercenaries see one of their own.

name: Bookish Cowl
description: You hide behind a hood of lore and learned references to impress scholars and mages.

name: Swamp Whisper
description: You adopt the hushed tones and mannerisms of Bayouque folk to slip past suspicion.

name: Railmaster’s Pomp
description: You sport oil‑smudged gloves and precise jargon to command respect from engineers and captains.
advantages: Steel and Steam of the Erie Road

name: Holy Symbol
description: A discreet emblem of faith lends you credibility with clergy, cultists, and the devout.

name: Frontier Charm
description: A wink, a drawl, and a knowing nod—outcasts and gamblers flock to you as one of their own.

name: Mystic Veil
description: You veil your emotions and speak in riddles to intrigued adepts—and frustrate ordinary folk.

name: Gilded Demeanor
description: You present yourself as polished merchant‑aristocracy, winning nods in opulent salons.

name: Merchant’s Ledger
description: You quote precise figures and tradesman’s gossip to gain the ear of shopkeepers and bankers.

name: Cloak of Shadows
description: A furtive stare and quiet steps make you welcome among thieves and spy‑rings.

name: Saloon Swagger
description: A hard‑won smirk and cock of the hat endear you to riverboat gamblers and drifters.

name: Frontier Resolve
description: Your steely gaze and terse speech fit right in with militia and Warden’s agents.

name: Inventor’s Smudge
description: Grease‑spotted goggles and sketchbook in hand win favor among artisans and engineers.

name: Bayou’s Lament
description: A lilting drawl and mournful tune bind you to Fontaine’s worshippers and swamp dwellers.

name: Scholar’s Quill
description: A well‑worn quill and know‑it‑all pose earn you respect in universities and arcane halls.

name: Desert’s Roar
description: A booming voice and dust‑browned cloak mark you as a son of the dunes to Oro’s people.

name: Woodland Canticle
description: You hum ancient forest songs that put Sequoia guardians and Huldu at ease.
